definition[0]_en: A material that is composed of the acetate ester of cellulose.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is composed of the acetate ester of cellulose.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment or dye bound in an emulsion of acrylic resin.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment or dye bound in an emulsion of acrylic resin.

definition[0]_en: A material that is a non-magnetic metal, usually alloyed, that is ductile and malleable with a lustre that ranges from grey to silver.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is a non-magnetic metal, usually alloyed, that is ductile and malleable with a lustre that ranges from grey to silver.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a high-grade white cardboard, most commonly made by pasting together sheets of heavy ledger paper.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a high-grade white cardboard, most commonly made by pasting together sheets of heavy ledger paper.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a closely woven textile made in various weights, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a support for painting or printing; or a loosely woven, lattice-like mesh, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a needlepoint foundation.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a closely woven textile made in various weights, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a support for painting or printing; or a loosely woven, lattice-like mesh, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a needlepoint foundation.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a type of stiff sheet typically made of good-quality chemical pulp or rag pulp, varying greatly in type and strength, and that is thicker than 0.1524 mm.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a type of stiff sheet typically made of good-quality chemical pulp or rag pulp, varying greatly in type and strength, and that is thicker than 0.1524 mm.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, fired at a high temperature to form a hard, brittle, heat- and corrosion-resistant material.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, fired at a high temperature to form a hard, brittle, heat- and corrosion-resistant material.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of fine-grained limestone, or a soft, earthy form of calcium carbonate.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of fine-grained limestone, or a soft, earthy form of calcium carbonate.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of the dark grey residue made of carbon, and any remaining ash, obtained by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and plant substances.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of the dark grey residue made of carbon, and any remaining ash, obtained by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and plant substances.

definition[0]_en: A material that is made by treating cellulose with acetic acid.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is made by treating cellulose with acetic acid.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a coloured substance dissolved or suspended in a liquid that can be absorbed by the base material.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a coloured substance dissolved or suspended in a liquid that can be absorbed by the base material.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of silicon dioxide, also known as silica, fused with one or more basic oxides; generally transparent but often translucent or opaque.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of silicon dioxide, also known as silica, fused with one or more basic oxides; generally transparent but often translucent or opaque.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment and a binding substance, and sometimes added inert materials, to form an opaque, coloured, water-soluble paint.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment and a binding substance, and sometimes added inert materials, to form an opaque, coloured, water-soluble paint.
scope note[0]_en: Poster paints are included. The term originally referred to the technique of oil paint applied on top of tempera.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a naturally occurring allotrope of carbon that is opaque, soft, greasy to the touch, and iron black to steel gray in colour.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a naturally occurring allotrope of carbon that is opaque, soft, greasy to the touch, and iron black to steel gray in colour.
scope note[0]_en: The material is used in the form of powder, sticks, or in pencils.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of any firm, dense, rigid board, often manufactured from fiber consolidated in a hot press.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of any firm, dense, rigid board, often manufactured from fiber consolidated in a hot press.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of laminated paper board that has paper layers glued to its surface.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of laminated paper board that has paper layers glued to its surface.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment or dye contained in a liquid or paste.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment or dye contained in a liquid or paste.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of the dentine forming the bulk of the teeth and tusks of animals such as elephants, walruses, and narwhals.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of the dentine forming the bulk of the teeth and tusks of animals such as elephants, walruses, and narwhals.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of polymers or acrylic compounds dissolved in volatile organic compounds or other solvents, that when dry is hard and durable.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of polymers or acrylic compounds dissolved in volatile organic compounds or other solvents, that when dry is hard and durable.
scope note[0]_en: The material is generally used as a finish that may be clear or coloured.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of the skin or hide of an animal that has been tanned to render it resistant to putrefaction and relatively soft and flexible when dry.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of the skin or hide of an animal that has been tanned to render it resistant to putrefaction and relatively soft and flexible when dry.

definition[0]_en: A material that is a natural or synthetic inorganic compound that consists of particles that are highly magnetic and are commonly used to store binary or analog information.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is a natural or synthetic inorganic compound that consists of particles that are highly magnetic and are commonly used to store binary or analog information.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a substance typified by being a good conductor of electricity and heat, opaque with a characteristic lustre, fusible, and usually malleable or ductile.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a substance typified by being a good conductor of electricity and heat, opaque with a characteristic lustre, fusible, and usually malleable or ductile.

definition[0]_en: A material that is made of cellulose nitrate plasticized with camphor.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is made of cellulose nitrate plasticized with camphor.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment suspended in a drying oil.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment suspended in a drying oil.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of thin material made from felted sheets or webs of animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic fibres formed and dried from a suspension in water.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of thin material made from felted sheets or webs of animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic fibres formed and dried from a suspension in water.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of calf, sheep, or goat skin which has been prepared to produce a thin, strong, translucent or opaque substance for writing, bookbinding, or other uses.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of calf, sheep, or goat skin which has been prepared to produce a thin, strong, translucent or opaque substance for writing, bookbinding, or other uses.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment mixed with a binder, usually in the form of a stick.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment mixed with a binder, usually in the form of a stick.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a powder prepared from calcium sulphate dihydrate, also known as gypsum, or calcium carbonate and mixed with water and sometimes a filler to form a paste that liberates heat and then hardens.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a powder prepared from calcium sulphate dihydrate, also known as gypsum, or calcium carbonate and mixed with water and sometimes a filler to form a paste that liberates heat and then hardens.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of synthetic or semi-synthetic organic polymers of high molecular weight that are moldable.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of synthetic or semi-synthetic organic polymers of high molecular weight that are moldable.

definition[0]_en: A material that is a category of polymers that contain the ester functional group in their main chain.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is a category of polymers that contain the ester functional group in their main chain.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a refractory white clay, known as kaolin, and a feldspathic rock that is heated to form a ceramic material.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a refractory white clay, known as kaolin, and a feldspathic rock that is heated to form a ceramic material.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of natural or synthetic polymers that have a high degree of resilience and elasticity.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of natural or synthetic polymers that have a high degree of resilience and elasticity.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of nonflammable cellulose acetate or polyester.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of nonflammable cellulose acetate or polyester.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of lac, a resinous substance excreted by the female lac insect, that can be dissolved in ethyl alcohol to form a liquid that can be applied with a brush.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of lac, a resinous substance excreted by the female lac insect, that can be dissolved in ethyl alcohol to form a liquid that can be applied with a brush.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of the integument of animals, such as sheep, goats, or calves, separated from the body and variously processed to remove hair, dry, tan, or otherwise dress.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of the integument of animals, such as sheep, goats, or calves, separated from the body and variously processed to remove hair, dry, tan, or otherwise dress.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of rock in its naturally occurring shape or that has been cut, shaped, crushed, or otherwise formed.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of rock in its naturally occurring shape or that has been cut, shaped, crushed, or otherwise formed.

definition[0]_en: A material that is created by processing man-made materials, usually as a substitute for a natural material.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is created by processing man-made materials, usually as a substitute for a natural material.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment mixed with a water-soluble binder medium, usually a glutinous material such as egg yolk or some other size, to form a permanent fast-drying painting medium.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment mixed with a water-soluble binder medium, usually a glutinous material such as egg yolk or some other size, to form a permanent fast-drying painting medium.

definition[0]_en: A material that is produced by weaving, felting, knotting, twining, or otherwise processing natural or synthetic fibers so that they cohere.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is produced by weaving, felting, knotting, twining, or otherwise processing natural or synthetic fibers so that they cohere.
scope note[0]_en: Excludes fibreboard, paper, papier-mâché, and papyrus.

definition[0]_en: A material that is manufactured from cellulose and a source of acetate esters, typically acetic anhydride.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that is manufactured from cellulose and a source of acetate esters, typically acetic anhydride.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of fine-quality calf or lamb parchment.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of fine-quality calf or lamb parchment.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a polymer or copolymer derived from a vinyl group, typically vinyl chloride.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a polymer or copolymer derived from a vinyl group, typically vinyl chloride.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of pigment suspended in water to form a transparent painting medium.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of pigment suspended in water to form a transparent painting medium.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of a chemical compound from an animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic source that is malleable near ambient temperatures, slightly greasy to the touch, with a low melting point, and usually translucent, water-repellant, and soluble in organic solvents.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of a chemical compound from an animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic source that is malleable near ambient temperatures, slightly greasy to the touch, with a low melting point, and usually translucent, water-repellant, and soluble in organic solvents.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of the principal tissue of trees and similar plants.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of the principal tissue of trees and similar plants.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of an emulsion of one or more light-sensitive layers of diazonium salts in a polyester or acetate base that react with dye couplers when processed to produce azo dye images.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of an emulsion of one or more light-sensitive layers of diazonium salts in a polyester or acetate base that react with dye couplers when processed to produce azo dye images.
scope note[0]_en: The material is usually applied to the base material of a microfilm or microfiche.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of an emulsion of a light-sensitive compound of silver and chlorine, bromine, iodine or fluorine suspended in a colloidal medium, usually gelatin.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of an emulsion of a light-sensitive compound of silver and chlorine, bromine, iodine or fluorine suspended in a colloidal medium, usually gelatin.
scope note[0]_en: The material is usually applied to the base material of a microfilm or microfiche.

definition[0]_en: A material that consists of an emulsion of one or more light-sensitive layers of diazonium salts in a polyester thermoplastic base that decompose on exposure to produce nitrogen bubbles, known as vesicles, that form a latent image, commonly blue or beige, which becomes visible and fixed when heated and allowed to cool.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A material that consists of an emulsion of one or more light-sensitive layers of diazonium salts in a polyester thermoplastic base that decompose on exposure to produce nitrogen bubbles, known as vesicles, that form a latent image, commonly blue or beige, which becomes visible and fixed when heated and allowed to cool.
scope note[0]_en: The material is usually applied to the base material of a microfilm or microfiche.
